shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: New task force launches to prevent sleep-related infant deaths
shorts.title_distilled: New task force launches to prevent sleep-related infant deaths.
shorts.description: The NEPA Sleep Safety Task Force, co-chaired by Meghan Lennox Gagorik, executive cirector of the Children’s Advocacy Center of Northeastern Pennsylvania, and Lackawanna County District Attorney Brian Gallagher, has been launched to address the alarming and preventable trend of sleep-related infant deaths in the region. The initiative was born out of conversations between CAC of NEPA and the DA’s office about how more could be done to protect children before tragedy strikes. Guided by CAC’s mission to promote safety, healing and justice, the task force brings together law enforcement, medical professionals, child welfare agencies and community leaders to educate families, […]
shorts.content: The NEPA Sleep Safety Task Force, co-chaired by Meghan Lennox Gagorik, executive cirector of the Children’s Advocacy Center of Northeastern Pennsylvania, and Lackawanna County District Attorney Brian Gallagher, has been launched to address the alarming and preventable trend of sleep-related infant deaths in the region. The initiative was born out of conversations between CAC of NEPA and the DA’s office about how more could be done to protect children before tragedy strikes. Guided by CAC’s mission to promote safety, healing and justice, the task force brings together law enforcement, medical professionals, child welfare agencies and community leaders to educate families, […]
shorts.content_distilled: NEPA Sleep Safety Task Force, co-chaired by Meghan Lennox Gagorik, executive cirector of the Children’s Advocacy Center of Northeastern Pennsylvania, and Lackawanna County District Attorney Brian Gallagher, has been launched to address the alarming and preventable trend of sleep-related infant deaths in the region.

shorts.title: Summer interns gain valuable experience at the Wright Center
shorts.title_distilled: Summer interns gain valuable experience at the Wright Center.
shorts.description: The Wright Centers for Community Health and Graduate Medical Education hosted Internship Capstone Poster Day at the health center in Scranton. Participating interns and the schools they are attending, from left, kneeling: Paige Walsh, University of Pittsburgh; Mya Maus, University of Scranton; Noah Lynch, Elizabethtown College; Matthew Dombrowski, University of Scranton; Shane Cegelka, King’s College; and Alexander Franklin, University of Scranton. Seated: Rebekah Feinberg, A.T. Still University; Remy Turrell, Wyoming Seminary; Krittika Boruah, Wyoming Seminary; Katherine Mena Pereyra, American University; Jiya Shah, Abington Heights High School; and Patricia McAndrew, King’s College. Standing: Alivia Minich, Penn State; Leelah Farrell, New York […]
shorts.content: The Wright Centers for Community Health and Graduate Medical Education hosted Internship Capstone Poster Day at the health center in Scranton. Seated: Rebekah Feinberg, A.T. shorts.title: HS SWIMMING: North Pocono’s Johnson enjoying first varsity season; Lackawanna League showdown highlights week
shorts.title_distilled: HS SWIMMING: North Pocono’s Johnson enjoying first varsity season; Lackawanna League showdown highlights week.
shorts.description: Like most in her sport, Alexandra Johnson started swimming at a young age with lessons at the YMCA. Each year, her instructors encouraged her to try competing. However, she ran into a challenge. As a student at North Pocono, which does not sponsor swimming, Johnson needed to find a way to race and give herself opportunities to develop her skills. She trains with the Pacers Aquatic Club team, and she competes as an exhibition athlete when Dunmore faces its opponents in the Lackawanna League schedule. The freshman isn’t the first to take this path; she’s just the latest and is […]
shorts.content: Like most in her sport, Alexandra Johnson started swimming at a young age with lessons at the YMCA. Each year, her instructors encouraged her to try competing. However, she ran into a challenge. As a student at North Pocono, which does not sponsor swimming, Johnson needed to find a way to race and give herself opportunities to develop her skills. She trains with the Pacers Aquatic Club team, and she competes as an exhibition athlete when Dunmore faces its opponents in the Lackawanna League schedule. The freshman isn’t the first to take this path; she’s just the latest and is […]
shorts.content_distilled: Like most in her sport, Alexandra Johnson started swimming at a young age with lessons at the YMCA.
